page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area within this block is rural. This part of Worcestershire was predominantly a fruit growing area until fairly recently, when EEC regulations made small fruit farms uneconomical and offered financial incentives to the farmers if they grubbed up their trees and bushes. The road from Stanford to Clifton at one time formed part of a "blossom route" favoured by tourists. It remains a very attractive area. Stanford was dominated by the Winnington family, of Stanford Court. The farms which still belong to the Estate have well-built houses with land of a manageable area. Stanford is well-kept by the caring local residents. It is in a fairly prosperous area, peopled by farmers, business people and professionals.
